meanings.definition: The rear part of a ship's hull.
meanings.sent1: The sternposts of the ship were painted blue.
meanings.sent2: The captain examined the sternposts for any damage.
meanings.sent3: The seagull perched on the sternposts, enjoying the view.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was as strong as the sternposts of a mighty vessel.
meanings.sent5: The old sailor could navigate by the stars using only the sternposts as a guide.

meanings.definition: A post at the stern of a vessel to which the rudder is attached.
meanings.sent1: The crew secured the rudder to the sternposts before setting sail.
meanings.sent2: The wooden sternposts were intricately carved with sea creatures.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous sailor tied a fish to the sternposts as a prank.
meanings.sent4: His loyalty to the captain was as steadfast as the sternposts of the ship.
meanings.sent5: The storm threatened to break the sternposts, but they held strong against the waves.
